entry.title: Service vs. Systemctl
entry.summary: The service and systemctl are two command line utilities used to manage system services and belong to two different init systems, SysV, and systemd respectively.

entry.title: Restart a Service using systemctl restart Command

entry.title: Linux systemctl reboot Command
entry.summary: The systemctl reboot command restarts the system in an organized way, since it is part of the system and is more aware of system services.

entry.title: How to View Systemctl Logs
entry.summary: To view logs of a unit or service after a recent boot use systemctl status unit-name command. To view detailed logs of a unit or service use the journalctl -u unit-name command.

entry.title: How to Use systemctl status Command
